runs.comm: got him, steered to the keeper for a golden duck! Some swing for Coulter-Nile, no foot movement from AB and he sort of pokes at it, visible edge and Peter Nevill pounces to his right to pouch a first-ball catch on debut!
scooped in the air, but wide of square leg! Short ball and he didn't deal with it very well, shovelled past the diving fielder
banged in at 144kph and this is fended through backward square for one
back of a length, de Kock dabs his first ball down into the leg side and calls for a sharp single... would have been tight if Zampa collected cleanly running in from midwicket
full outside off, du Plessis plinks a drive towards mid-off
pitched up around off stump and defended into the covers coming forwards
excellent start, teasing line and it has de Kock fumbling like a lusty teenager outside off, beats the outside edge
good length, in the channel and again de Kock reaches for it, half an appeal for caught behind but nothing doing
shortish, on the body, nudged to leg
swings to leg, across the line and gets a big top edge... that sails over the slips and ends up bouncing towards the rope, third man coming across to prevent four
lashed over the covers, free-flowing stroke from de Kock, just a step out to the line and cleared the infield
pitched up outside off and punched along the carpet to mid-off
big inside edge past the stumps! It was full and tempting the drive, du Plessis gets lucky
short ball, taking the pace off, shuffles across and swings and misses
dug in, decent pace and bounce for Coulter-Nile but du Plessis shows fast hands in flipping it up and away over square leg for four
length outside off stump, gets one down to third man

full and straight, de Kock plays across the line again... and this time the top edge ends up in the hands of the bowler! It was a slower ball from Coulter-Nile, cutting his fingers over it, deceived de Kock and the ball went straight up to be taken halfway down the pitch
short ball, again du Plessis swipes it off his hip, a short-arm jab and deep backward square leg does exceptionally well on the boundary to keep them to two
angled across the left-hander and Duminy slashes his first run in the air through backward point
fractionally too straight, du Plessis waits in the crease and nudges to leg for one more
good length, sliding across the batsman outside off, Duminy watches it through
tight lines around off stump, pushed square on the off side
length ball, 137kph on off stump, stabbed into the covers
short ball, Duminy swings across the line and fails to connect
tossed up and worked away to leg for one
darted on the stumps and Duminy flicks in the air through midwicket
full and floaty outside off, spanked down the ground for four... Du Plessis smacks cleanly through the line
backs away to leg and Maxwell follows him with a flat, quick one
tossed up on the stumps - and slotted into the crowd at deep square leg! Brutal blow from du Plessis, who's taking some personal revenge for Finch's mauling of Duminy earlier
down the ground again, clearing the man at mid-off and it bounces away for four more
shortish, backs away and steers to third man
back of a length, moves to off and swipes a pull through square leg
on the stumps, swings to leg, gets this into a gap and they come back for two
shortish, on the pull - and picks out midwicket! Duminy didn't connect cleanly, came off the toe straight to Finch, who took it above his head. A roll of the Tye die works for Smith
stroked through the covers for four first ball! Tye went round the wicket, slightly overptiched and Rossouw got low to drill the ball to the deep extra cover boundary
tighter line, not quite so full, defended into the off side
short outside off, du Plessis attempts a cut and gets a bottom edge down into the turf
straighter line, worked to midwicket
full length a foot outside off, du Plessis crouches like a ninja assassin and nun-chucks a drive through mid-off
angled across on off stump, punched down the ground
full on off stump, 137kph, Faf opens the face and steers to backward point
full outside off, crunched through the covers coming forwards, cut off on the rope but they get a couple
dragged down slightly, Rossouw drops back and pulls into a gap between long-on and deep midwicket
tossed up on the stumps, worked away to leg and again they come back for two
pushed through outside off, Rossouw chops off the back foot straight to backward point
looped up nice and slow outside off, not much turn to speak of, slapped through the covers
quicker, on middle and leg, nurdled through mid-on
flighted, on the stumps, worked around the front pad to deep midwicket
excellent line and length from Tye, beats the bat as Rossouw pokes at it outside off
slower ball, slightly short and Rossouw goes to pull, mistimes it through square leg... looks like a bat-breaker, right off the corner of the toe
comes forward and drives a single into a gap at mid-off
full toss from Tye... and it squeezes past backward point off an outside edge for four
another full toss - this looks like it'll be a no-ball on height - and Rossouw does well to keep it eye on it and clout one in the air out towards long-on
goes over the wicket, good length and rifled square off the back foot, straight to deep point for one
round the wicket, pitched up and driven in front of square, good running and a dive from Rossouw brings them back for two

full on off stump and scooped impudently over short fine leg! Outrageous stuff from du Plessis, even if we're used to seeing that sort of thing these days... huge bravery, too, head down and trusting his reflexes to get the ball away
short of a length, goes back and across and drills one more through the covers
full toss, room to swing the arms... and he's sliced it straight to backward point! Rossouw winces as he walks off, bit village all round, that. Nicely taken by the diving Khawaja, though

run out, du Plessis gone now! Miller dropped his first ball down behind square, they go for the quick single but Nevill was quicker than both, swooping to his left and under-arming on to the stumps with Faf half a yard short of his ground

good length on off stump, driven into the covers... and there's another direct hit! He's safe but only just! Warner was the man at mid-off, he arrowed the throw in to the non-striker's end but Wiese was through the crease in time
pitched up outside off and driven into the covers
back of a length in the corridor, Wiese opens the face and runs one to third man
pitched up and driven through mid-on for another single
back of a length outside off and Wiese hangs out an angled bat, nearly chops on
baseball swing, connects well - you'rrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrree outta heeeeeeeeeeeeeeeerrrrrreeee! Murderous swing of the bat from Wiese, carts the ball high over cow corner for a Dorothy
shorter this time, clothed to the leg side on the pull
short ball, wide off the off stump - called on height
full and straight and squirted away through square leg for one more
floated up around off stump, stands tall and defends
pushed through, Wiese opens up his body and steers one through point
floated up a little slower, Miller sweeps and maybe gets a bit of edge on it, loops off the pad to the off side, Nevill won't get there
comes forward and pushes one through mid-on
flat legbreak outside off, goes back and whirls the hands through a meaty blow, sliced to backward point

tossed up full on the stumps, firmly bunted down the ground, looks good for a straight four... until Glenn Maxwell whizzes into view and pulls of a full-stretch dive to keep the ball in play. Brilliant, fingertip work, sliding in front of the rope to prevent four
round the wicket, short ball at the body, Miller connects well with a flat pull that runs away behind square
shortish again, goes across and pulls, comes off the thigh pad to short fine leg
over the wicket, slower ball outside off, Wiese gets a bottom edge into the covers trying to cut
length on off, worked wristily through square leg, into a gap and they trundle back for two

uh-oh spaghetti-ohs! This is an almighty mix up and someone has been run out... Looks like Wiese is trudging off. Miller had played the ball down between his legs, he didn't know exactly where it had gone, Wiese came charging through and by the time Miller tried to send him back they were both at the same end. Hastings kept calm to run down in his follow through and gently toss the ball back to the non-striker's end and complete the job
worked off the legs to keep the strike
tossed up on middle and leg, Miller walks out and punches down the ground
flighted, outside off, spins and beats the bat as Morris attempts to sweep
flatter, on off stump, pushed back down the track
touch shorter, waits in the crease and punches through cover point
slightly leg side, Miller flicks and misses... as does Nevill and it runs away fine
tossed up and that's a powerful sweep from Miller, hard and flat for four through deep square leg
gives it some air, on off stump, drilled through cover for another single
round the wicket, Miller pushes a drive to extra cover
shorter length, angling in, worked through square leg coming down the track
pick-up flick over midwicket, just a chip off the pads but it's well placed and bounces away between two men for four
on the stumps and worked through backward square
fired in full, Miller glances another single off his pads
full outside off, Morris winds up for a belt down the ground, squeezes it into the pitch... and Marsh leaps magnificently to his right to grab it in his follow through and prevent a run
round the wicket, full and driven through the covers
pitched up and punched down the ground for one
that's in his arc... and almost out the park! Miller unleashes the homicidal maniac inside and heaves Tye over deep midwicket
full on leg stump, bunted down the ground and they hurtle back for two

that is OUTTA HERE! Slightly short from Tye and Miller swings like Benny Goodman in his pomp, sends it on to the tin roof at deep square leg and it bounces all the way out of the ground... Further than Coulter-Nile's blow earlier in the day
takes some of the pace off it, mistimed back towards the bowler
short ball, Morris shuffles across and pulls one in front of square to give "Killer" Miller the strike
miscued but safe! Coulter-Nile bowls a cute cutter and Miller sends a top edge spiralling behind square on the leg side... between two fielders, though, and they get a couple more
fired full and wide as Miller set himself to hit over cover - just outside the tramlines
fired in on the stumps, can't get it away through midwicket
short ball, possible taking the pace off, Miller adjusts to swat it away through midwicket

slogged over extra cover, not got all of it - gottim, brilliant from Finch! Superb work, running across from mid-off, he barreled to his left and took it at full stretch, tumbling over before sitting up, looking like a pleased teddy bear. Morris just needed to hang around with Miller but he's holed out, the finisher finished
angled in from round the wicket, worked into a gap at midwicket, Miller will keep the strike
brilliant shot, lashed through the covers in front of the sweeper for four! He picked the slower ball and threw his hands through the shot
short of a length, swivels on a pull to deep backward square
good length on the stumps, Abbott stands back and prods it to Hastings' right, he can't quite get down and they scamper one
dug into the pitch, cutting his fingers over it, Miller swings and misses outside off

that's gone! Fully over the stand at deep square leg this time! Miller adjusts his range and attaches a rocket to a full, leg-stump ball from Hastings, sends it fizzing beyond the rope, beyond the stadium, possibly beyond the city limits... and yet it's still only worth six
full, slower ball, dug out down the ground
tossed up nice and full, punched back to the bowler
goes back in the crease and clips one through square leg
pushed through outside off, Abbott drops back and steers it straight to backward point
short from Zampa, width to swing the arms and slap one to deep point - 150 up for SA, closing in

tossed up full on leg stump, Miller advances and whips the ball wide of long-on - another good stop on the rope prevents four but Miller will chalk up his first fifty in T20 internationals, a fine knock
full on the stumps and Miller drives one through the covers to keep the strike for the final over
round the wicket, full on the stumps, Miller punches through the covers again... hesitated before taking the single
or not! Abbott slugs it straight back down the ground to seal victory! A solid tailender's whack and South Africa win by three wickets to go 1-0 up in the three-match series
